results.title: Mr Pickwick's dilemma from 'Pickwick Papers'
results.creator_credit: Desmond Davis, Coronet Films and Dickension Society, London
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”
An amusing episode in which Mr Pickwidk stumbles into the wrong bedroom, is challenged to a duel, and then arrested. He extricates himseslf with the aid of that remarkable man-servant, Sam Weller. From the Charles Dickens story, “The Pickwick Papers”.

results.title: Mozart and his music
results.brief_description: The film traces the development of Mozart’s music at different periods in his life by showing the people and places which probably influenced his music; the house in Salzburg where he was born; scenes in Rome, Milan and Naples where he was acclaimed a boy genius; and Vienna where he later lived and composed some of his most important works. Excerpts from the following are included in the film: the Overture to the “Marriage of Figaro”; the First, Second and Third Movements of the Piano Concerto No. 23; the “Requiem” from the Requiem Mass; the Overture and “Batti, batti” aria from “Don Giovanni”; and the Allegro Movement from the Piano Sonata in C. Major.

results.title: Movies learn to talk
results.creator_credit: Burton Benjamin, Columbia Broadcasting System, Kenco Films and Prudential Insurance Company of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Traces the development of sound movies from early experiments with clumsy systems at the turn of the century to “The Jazz Singer” in 1927 and the polished and sophisticated sound film of today. Includes glimpses of film personalities and excerpts from silent and sound movies. Narrated by Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Movies in the mill
results.creator_credit: Allen Stark, Bernard Devlin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Fred Davis discovers how a strip of celluloid becomes a film when he visits a National Film Board production crew on location and the Board’s Ottawa studios. Directors, photographers, film editors, sound technicians, animation artists and many others demonstrate the various elements that go into the making of NFB films. Shows how sound is recorded, film footage is cut and edited to give proper visual balance, the sound track of a film is made also takes a look at the laboratory processes. Photographed by Donald Wilder, edited by Marion Meadows.

results.title: A Mountain's domain
results.creator_credit: Robert Walker, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates
results.brief_description: The mountain is Mount Warning in the north-eastern part of New South Wales. Its domain is the warm, colorful scenery of the Tweed and Byron Rivers and Gold Coast region. This tourist film is packed with landscape, but it also dwells upon the people of the north-east who are as important to the region as its climate and natural beauty.

results.title: Mountain sanctuary
results.brief_description: In Western Tasmania, rugged mountain peaks and secret Alpine lakes beckon the bush walker and mountaineer. Explores thoroughly the beautiful Tasmanian highlands where unique flora and fauna, including Tasmanian devils, wombats, native cats, and black swans are found.

results.title: Motivation and reward in learning
results.creator_credit: Gardner Hart, Neal E. Miller and Pennsylvania State College Productions
results.brief_description: Records experimental demonstrations with white rats to illustrate the importance of motivation and reward in learning. Compares a hungry, active rat with a saitated, inactive rat. The hungry animal learns to get food by pressing a bar, while the satiated animal goes to sleep. To demonstrate that failure to learn is due to lack of motivation, a mild electric shock is supplied and the satiated animal becomes active and learns to strike a lever which turns off the shock. Shows the animal also learning to rotate a wheel, bite a rubber tube, and strike another animal to avoid electric shock.

results.title: Motivating the class
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Educational Psychology”.
Portrays a student-teacher trying to interest a class in the subject of mathematics. His mistakes and achievements are shown with explanatory comments by his supervisory teacher. The students are first taught in an abstract fashion, without relating the subject to the interests of the student. Later, mathematics are applied to subjects of student interest, student participation is encouraged, outdoor projects are undertaken leading to more effective teaching.

results.title: Mother infant interaction: forms of feeding at six weeks
results.creator_credit: Sylvia Brody, Film-Rite and New York Infant Development Project
results.brief_description: This film shows over one hundred infants and their mothers who were studied to try and work out a pattern of behaviour during the baby’s feeding. Seven types were noticed within the schema of empathy, control and efficiency. Those mothers who showed positive signs of all of these did best. Many mothers showed little sensitivity to the needs of their babies and this was still obvious a year later.
